sources.title: Microsoft Teams will help you speak in a foreign language during meetings
sources.snippet:
Microsoft Teams is introducing a new real-time AI-powered interpreter feature in early 2025, allowing meeting participants to speak and listen in their preferred language. This tool uses speech-to-speech translation and can simulate a user's personal voice in another language. Initially supporting up to nine languages, this feature is part of broader AI enhancements within Teams. Additionally, multilingual transcription for up to 31 languages will be supported for meeting transcripts.

Other enhancements include AI-powered summaries of visual content from PowerPoint or the web shown during meetings, and the ability of Microsoft Copilot to summarize files shared in the Teams chat. Microsoft will also roll out a Teams Super Resolution feature for Copilot Plus PCs using local NPU chips to improve video call quality under weak internet conditions. Developers will gain access to image super resolution APIs, and updates to the Copilot Runtime will introduce functions such as image segmentation, object erase, and image description.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Zoom / Teams built-in translation ‚Äì Zoom‚Äôs interpretation channels and Teams‚Äô AI interpreter reduce setup overhead if you already use those platforms. Tactiq+1

Why these matter: software integrates with presentations, supports many languages, and handles large audiences without extra hardware. üîπ 2) Mobile Apps (Cheapest / most flexible) If you want something standalone without enterprise platforms: Google Translate (Conversation mode, now live translate with AI headset support) ‚Äî free and broad language coverage. Tom's Guide
Microsoft Translator ‚Äî decent speech translation and integrates with Teams. BeLikeNative

sources.title: These $140 earbuds translate 50+ languages while you listen
sources.snippet: The Mymanu Orb Open-Ear AI Translation Earbuds, showcased at CES 2026, offer users a unique blend of audio entertainment, real-world awareness, and advanced language translation technology. Priced at $139.99 (down from a $179.99 MSRP), these earbuds feature an open-ear design that allows users to hear their surroundings while simultaneously listening to music, taking calls, or translating real-time conversations. The standout feature is their built-in AI, which supports translation in over 50 languages across live conversations, phone calls, and spoken audio‚Äîideal for travel, work, or multilingual environments. Beyond translation, the earbuds function as typical audio accessories with a sleek, lightweight, and water-resistant design. With up to 35 hours of battery life using the charging case and hands-free controls, they offer a user-friendly and futuristic audio solution without added complexity.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Limitations: less accurate with technical content and not ideal for simultaneous conference translation on its own. üîπ 3) Hardware Translators For in-person translation without depending on participants‚Äô phones: These exist but are niche ‚Äî dedicated devices like AI earbuds or standalone translators can work but often don‚Äôt outperform phone/tablet apps in accuracy and flexibility at scale. SFGATE
